Sync="TRUE">ESRI</attrdefs><attrdomv><udom Sync="TRUE">Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.</udom></attrdomv><atprecis Sync="TRUE">0</atprecis><attscale Sync="TRUE">0</attscale></attr></detailed></eainfo><dataqual><lineage><procstep><procdesc>It was determined by analyzing the bridge location data that it could and should be updated using resources currently available - namely ArcGIS and NAIP imagery. The bridge database contains attributes for determining location by 2 methods, linear referencing and lat lon coordinates. A shapefile using each location method was generated.  The shapefile generated by lat lon oordinates was chosen as the file to keep and update. The shapefile created using linear referencing as well as various other layers useful for location reference were overlayed. NAIP imagery was the primary layer used for locating bridges and aligning roads. Each bridge feature was viewed individually.They were then moved to the appropriate location as observed on the NAIP image. Where road geometry was missing in ITDs' road layer for the bridge locations, it was added.   Where existing road geometry did not align with the NAIP imagery it was realigned. When discovered, inaccuracies to the linear referencing model were corrected.</procdesc><procsv>ArGIS 9.2</procsv><procdate>20121004</procdate></procstep></lineage><logic>ESRI feature type: Simple, Geometry: Point</logic><complete>Contains Non-State Highway bridges 20 feet or longer in Idaho</complete><posacc><horizpa><horizpar>Exceeds National Map Accuracy Standards for 1:24,000 scale maps. Based on empirical judgement. Placed using NAIP imagery 5m horizontal accuracy</horizpar><qhorizpa><horizpav>100</horizpav><horizpae>none</horizpae></qhorizpa></horizpa><vertacc><vertaccr>none</vertaccr><qvertpa><vertaccv>1</vertaccv><vertacce>none</vertacce></qvertpa></vertacc></posacc></dataqual><metainfo><metd
